column2: 1. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column6: gives you time to react to situations.
column8: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 2. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column6: be aware possible hazards ahead.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 3. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the time of day.
column8: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column10: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 4. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column6: are only found in school zones.
column8: are usually red and blue in color.

column6: School zone ahead
column8: Pedestrians must not cross

column2: 7. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column6: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column8: speed up.
column10: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.

column6: No Bicycle zone
column8: Bicycles have the right-of-way

column2: 9. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: emergency flashers.
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 10. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column8: must proceed with caution.
column10: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 11. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Service signs
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column6: Railroad Crossing
column8: Limited parking

column6: a reduction of lanes sign.
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column4: that you must not drive past this sign.
column6: the entrance to a construction site.
column8: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column10: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a low place in the road.

column6: turn on your hazard lights.
column8: drive the speed limit.

column6: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
column8: do not need more room to maneuver.

column2: 19. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 20. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 21. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column6: Alcohol does not
column8: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit

column2: 22. If your wheels drop off the pavement onto the shoulder of the road, you should:
column4: immediately come to a complete stop, then quickly turn back onto the pavement.
column6: maintain your current speed and turn onto the pavement.
column8: slow down and carefully turn back onto the pavement.
column10: stop your car on the side of the road.

column2: 23. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.

column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column6: blue rectangles.
column8: green rectangles.

column2: 26. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 27. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: signal.
column8: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.

column6: Do not enter
column8: Stop

column6: loss of concentration.
column8: poor judgment.

column2: 30. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: pedestrians only.
column8: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 31. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: They give directional information.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column6: Divided highway ahead
column8: Divided highway ends
